document_data.name: Fimril
document_data.mainbody: '''Fimril''' of [[Westgate]] was a mageling of the [[Zhentarim]] in the mid-14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Description: He had dark eyes and wore a black robe.
document_data.Personality: To [[Sarhthor]], like most magelings of the [[Zhentarim]], Fimril was dark-hearted and ambitious. Though he bore a spark of self-doubt, he was brave, arrogant, and indeed ambitious, believing himself capable of rising to the top of the Zhentarim, and considering that people who talked back to him in a way he disapproved of could be done without.
document_data.Abilities:
Fimril was able to use a slaying spell that consumed a crushed black [[pearl]] as its [[material component]], almost certainly ''[[death spell]]''. His version of the spell, however, was strong enough to kill him and his comrades too. He had also devised a unique spell that took him an entire year to construct, which created a moving barrier of all-devouring darkness, a spell powerful enough to counter [[spellfire]].{{cite book/Crown of Fire/TPB 2002|107-109|6}}

Another strange power of Fimril was a very draining spell that called up images from the ashes of a fire, allowing a mage to see what had transcurred while it was burning.{{cite book/Crown of Fire/TPB 2002|74|4}}
document_data.Relationships: He'd been either trained or tested by Sarhthor. [[Lyrkon]], [[Glondar]], and [[Duthspurn]] were both part of the squad to which he was assigned.
